sectioninfo.title: Information That Applies to All the Scenarios

section.para: The user entity is Lane Components, Inc. (Lane) that manufactures electrical connectors and distributes them nationally and internationally, primarily to manufacturers. Several years ago, it sold a large division and used the proceeds to begin building a portfolio of equity securities traded on an exchange regulated by the SEC. Lane views the portfolio as a source of funds for future business acquisitions and plant expansions.

Lane accounts for the securities under FASB (ASC) 321, , and, accordingly, reports the securities at their fair value, with unrealized holding gains and losses included in earnings. Accounting Standards Codification Investments — Equity Securities

sectioninfo.titleabbrev: Types of Potential Misstatements of the Entity’s Assertions About Its Financial Instruments and Financial Instrument Transactions
sectioninfo.title: Types of Potential Misstatements of the Entity’s Assertions About Its Financial Instruments and Financial Instrument Transactions

section.para: The auditor identifies the following seven types of potential misstatements of Lane’s assertions about its financial instrument transactions:

The recorded financial instruments do not exist, and the recorded financial instrument transactions did not occur.
a.

Lane does not have the rights and obligations associated with ownership of the recorded financial instruments.
b.

The entity’s financial instruments and financial instrument transactions were not recorded.
c.

The fair value of the recorded financial instruments was determined incorrectly.
d.

Realized and unrealized holding gains and losses are not properly reported as earnings.
e.

Disclosures about financial instruments and financial instrument transactions are not adequate.
f.

sectioninfo.titleabbrev: Inherent Risk Factors the Auditor Considers in Planning the Audit
sectioninfo.title: Inherent Risk Factors the Auditor Considers in Planning the Audit

section.para: The financial instruments are traded on an exchange regulated by the SEC, and the features of the instruments, underlying transactions, and accounting considerations are relatively straightforward. The auditor assesses inherent risk for all assertions about financial instruments and financial instrument transactions as low.

The auditor decides to perform substantive procedures for assertions about financial instruments at year-end because of the relatively small number of financial instruments and financial instrument transactions.

The carrying amount of the financial instruments and the realized and unrealized gains and losses on them are material to Lane’s financial statements, but dividends on the financial instruments are not material to the financial statements.
